website_summaries.verdict: Jam out anywhere with a portable, two-channel amp that can plug in or run off batteries.
pros: A compact, lightweight speaker geared toward players seeking performance freedom
It features clean and overdrive channels, tape delay effects, and an auxiliary jack so you can play along with any of your favorite tracks
The auxiliary  jack can also be used with headphones for “silent” practice
cons: At 3 watts, this amp isn’t very loud

customer_reviews.title: Tiny box, Unexpectedly Pleased.
customer_reviews.text: When I seen the size of the shipping box, I immediately was disappointed, as I pulled it out, I laughed... I kept laughing until I plugged my guitar in & turned the volume up. I wasn’t expecting this amp to put out & sound good. It’s small enough to take anywhere. You won’t be rockin any shows with this amp but you will be able to travel & enjoy your playing. I really love the mobility of this amp.
customer_reviews.author: Marc (Stone Wall) Harper

customer_reviews.title: Impressed in every way - Nothing I would change
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted something to use in a pinch anywhere, I envisioned 3 inch speaker would be about right for very low level use. Once I saw this had Delay as it's only effect I knew this was good, no other effect would have the same bang for buck. It's well built, comes loaded with batteries for those xmas mornings or for me lack of patience to turn it on. It is way louder than I really needed, the cleans, the crunchy and the Lead/OD are all good. It has all the necessary features to dial out a bad tone. The only wish is for a multi-knob EQ configuration, this has one to sweep through hi to low predominance.
customer_reviews.author: pizelli

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include a power cord? Misleading description. Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: The description says battery or DC powered. Further in the description it says "capable of being battery powered". Would a normal person reading this description think that "capable of" means "mandatory unless you buy the power cord separately"? I read the entire description. I read the entire outside of the box the unit comes in. Nowhere does it mean mention that the power cord isn't included. When was the last time you bought something that could be plugged in or battery powered and it came with the batteries but without the cord? For me the answer is never. Will return the unit. I do not support companies who mislead their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Flynn Waltman

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I was expecting too much?
customer_reviews.text: Meh, really disappointed. Maybe I was expecting too much out of something this small. I bought this to practice, but it hummed too loud, picking up other electrical things in the room, and just sounded cheap to me. l couldn’t get a good volume without turning up the gain, I’m not sure the volume knob did anything. The sound just wasn’t there like I expected. Returned it today.
customer_reviews.author: Bigkane01

customer_reviews.title: Great amp
customer_reviews.text: Great amp so far (couple days old). Volume, tone, and overdrive are impressive for such a small package. ISF feature's interesting, but doesn't seem to add much variation absent separate bass, treble, mid controls (maybe more/less "crunch", which is nice). Connecting my guitar to the amp through a VOX AP2AC amPlug AC30 G2 makes for bigger and more versatile sound. Would have issued five stars, but the Planet Waves 9V power supply Amazon recommended (and I bought) did not fit the amp. Amazon refunded the power supply purchase, however, but I had to chat w/a rep to get it done--no "automated" return for the power supply permitted online.
customer_reviews.author: DSS1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect practice amp. PERFECT. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: It's an awesome amp. I use it to practice at my yogurt shop. I play a 57 original strat through it. People compliment me on the guitar, but laugh at me when they see the amp...until they hear me play blues licks.
customer_reviews.author: Superman

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped
customer_reviews.text: After hearing countless glowing reviews on this, I picked up my own only to be shocked at how mediocre it was. Sure, in terms of portability it's an achievement, but what's the point if the sound is horrible? The clean signal is somewhat palatable, but it all goes down the toilet once the overdrive comes in. Awful sound. I can only imagine in hindsight that most of these positive reviews we're written by happy parents buying their children's first amp. If you're even remotely serious about your guitar-playing, this is a novelty at best; a toy at worst. I'd recommend literally anything over this (especially at near $100!).
customer_reviews.author: Where Are My Droids?

customer_reviews.title: Sounds really good and it's super handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought my son a Boss katana mini and myself this one thinking he would have the superior amp for practice and lessons. This Blackstar gets some super sweet sounds. I play mostly clean with a little delay to simulate reverb and it does the job perfectly for nearly half the price of the katana. The katana is a solid buy too, but this blackstar takes the cake for $40 less.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Woot

customer_reviews.title: Wow, just wow!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this speaker. I match it with a wireless guitar system and move around with an ultra portable great sounding amp. I've already been inspired to write some things, something I can't say about a much lower quality clip on amp that I got last year. Sounds doesn't break up at any volume, batteries seen to lasta good while (haven't used up the first set yet) and the extension definitely adds some further power. I love not requiring the extension though! AC adapter is high quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H

customer_reviews.title: Articulate personal practice amp.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. The sound is articulate. Clear as a bell when you want or as overdriven as you want. Crisp clear highs / good rich lows. Played through speakers and headphones this little amp plays as well as an amp 10x it’s size. Headphones are really clear through this little boomer. So for loud practice by yourself or for silent practice through phones this is the amp.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly decent sound
customer_reviews.text: This is not a gigging amp. This is not a studio amp. This is not going to replace your Fender or Mesa Boogie or Marshall. However, this is perfect for bedroom noodling, as it has decent clean and dirt tones at low volume, is portable (if you need that), and can use input from your phone/aux in to play along with whatever you want. I've tried a few micro amps and this is one of the better ones, and the best (in my opinion) for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: gEm

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound for such a small unit. Perfect for practice and even playing for small groups. The “clean” setting is fantastic. For OD and reverb I prefer the sound with guitar pedals (which I already had.) Impressive that it came with super alkaline batteries installed. It’s a very nice unit. I love how compact and powerful it is. I also got the extension speaker to create a “micro stack.”
customer_reviews.author: Stan57Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Holy sh!t! Fantastic practice amp!
customer_reviews.text: -HUGE sound -ISF control is perfect for an amp this size -Serviceable overdrive (No heavy Metallica-type drive, though) -Full and clear Clean channel with adjustable gain -Does NOT sound like a plastic micro-amp -Nice tape delay effect -Batteries ARE included, but at some point get a power supply This blows other micro-sized practice amps (Marshall MS4, Orange, the mini-fenders) out of the water. You can get a lot of great sounding tones out of this thing. I have a Lil Smokey amp that has a line out to connect it to an external speaker/cab - works perfectly! Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: M. Napier

customer_reviews.title: I am stunned at the tone - great
customer_reviews.text: I guess I expected that this would sound small, but it does not sound small at all. It has super tone and adjustments - perfect to practice with since it sounds so good and is so small. I am now rocking my strat much more now that I can hear it like it should be heard. But, this thing works great with acoustic guitars as well - that surprised me but it certainly does that just as well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Franklin

customer_reviews.title: It lasted about a month. And more problems.
customer_reviews.text: The return window has passed and now I have to pay to ship the amp back to the U.S.A. affiliate. It just stopped producing sound. I followed the directions provided by an Amazon ' expert', no dice. I also used the provided power cord. Very disappointed. I received the mini amp replacement today. Problem is I returned the stereo amp and power cord also to KORG USA. This is becoming more than annoying. I just sent KORG USA an email asking for the rest of MY equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It's as good as the reviews say
customer_reviews.text: I bought it mainly as a collector's item. After playing it for a minute, I retired my old Pignose. I also bought the Fly3 Bass amp, which had an annoying rattling sound. I took it apart, tightened up the screws a bit, and my bassist friend sometimes uses it when changing strings or setting up a bridge. I've used my Fly3 as a hotel room speaker for composing synth tracks and listening to music, and as monitors when jamming at home sometimes. I wish the extension cab came in union jack style. The stereo set plus power supply is well worth the price even if you only use it for music listening.
customer_reviews.author: J. McGill

customer_reviews.title: Dope!!
customer_reviews.text: This little amp is awesome! Loud for it's size, and easy to throw into a bag and take along for easy jam sessions wherever you want to bring an electric guitar. You can also hook up your phone or whatever and play tunes through it. I use it all the time. Batteries last a really long time in it as well. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable tone
customer_reviews.text: This thing is unbelievable. If you're looking for a small practice amp and care about tone then this is the one for you. We mic'd it on stage and blew everyone's mind with how good it sounded. I've played through a lot of these small practice amps and this one is hands down the best. This was my first experience with Blackstar now I'm looking into their full sized amps because I'm so pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Humphrey-Tech

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad thing. The only issue is that it is noisy (even when guitar is silent). With the gain and volume nobs at around 9 o'clock the humming becomes quite annoying. Using the same guitar I do not have such humming with other amps. This amp obviously is not something fantastic, simply because it is hard to expect such a small thing to give you a tube amp's tone, but all in all, for it's price, this piece of gear is quite decent.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ashley

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the pickers in your life.  Thanks son.  Love, Dad
customer_reviews.text: This was a Father's Day gift from one of my sons, also a picker. I have vintage Marshall's, Mesa Boogies to name just a few. I've played Les Paul's, SG's, Strats and acoustics through this little thing. Every thing from AC/DC to slapback rockabilly. The mini technology is truly amazing. The YouTube demo's are not B.S.. I can even sit on my back porch and play. One of the best items I've ever received from Amazon. Get one for the picker in your life!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. Harwood

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the AC adapter
customer_reviews.text: I am really loving this. IT creates great sound versatility and it's pretty loud. Also, doesn't need the ac adapter. I was worried but decided to buy it without because for a power cord $14-18 seemed pretty egregious. I've had it for a month and still haven't had to change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: AK zero°bike

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: --- NO BS REVIEW --- - Why I bought it? I needed a portable amp for my electric guitar. - What I like? It is small and light, but it sounds great. - What I don't like? No distortion channel or drums/metronome. Power supply is not included. CONCLUSION: At this price range this is one of the best portable amps that you are going to find, if not the best. As an alternative, if you have a higher budget you may want to check out the NUX Mighty Lite BT
customer_reviews.author: Alexander B.

customer_reviews.title: Great amp overall... just needs a little bit more fine tuning.
customer_reviews.text: The price, sound, and portability are overall amazing, except for its' versatility. I just think it needs a little bit more functionality as an amp, as in more dials to even out the quality of sound. It's somewhat plain and basic for an amp, which I understand due to its' price tag... but still. Also, I was hoping it would have some type of belt clip to go with it for on the go jam sessions. It's 4.4/5 stars for me. Would still recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit89

customer_reviews.title: Beast for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Its small, portable and sounds great. All that is relatively to its price and size obviously - this is no 5k$ tube amp and not even a 500$ modeling amp. Not beeing tied to an electric socket is great. I also use a wireless kit so no cables at all. Battery life is phenomenal. With about 2 hours a week it lasted 11 months on original batteries, and that is also because forgot to turn it off one day. I would advise to get the extension cab as well - sound is a bit more alive. If you get a psu get a Blackstar one - the non Blackstar ones die very fast and hum like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Good mini amp! Easy to carry around and battery operated. Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My son asked for this amp for his birthday so he could carry it back and forth from his home to his business and also around the house with ease. He can just pick it up and go to the basement or the garage or outside without needing power outlets. He doesn't get the sound of his big amp, but the sound and available volume are good enough for practice. He speaks very highly of the amp and insisted on this one in particular.
customer_reviews.author: ohblahdi

customer_reviews.title: LOUD
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun. The delay feature sounds incredible and the overdrive does the job. I bought these to play my Uke through. I like the fact that you can control the music on a phone or iPod so that you can play at the same time without it being too loud. The second speaker is a must if you want the extra volume. It is nice to have the power cord when the batteries give out.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: 105-112db Volume
customer_reviews.text: 105 dB max volume playing music through phone or with guitar on clean channel 112dB with Overdrive turned on That’s loud enough to cause hearing damage if sustained for over one minute close to the speaker. (At 105dB, you’ll have about 7.5m before hearing damage begins). Rock and roll, but think about whether you want to be able to be able to hear later in life (This warning has been brought to you by the no-fun alliance of those who did not die young and now have to ask people to repeat themselves a few times)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable amp.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for travel but it also works well with my Beat Buddy drum pedal. It has an aux input so I can plug in the pedal or phone/mp3 player without those getting distorted. Sound quality is what you would expect for a small amp. My opinion It seems to sound better for blues or classic rock with single coil pickups vs hard rock metal with humbuckers. Still a nice little practice amp. I hooked my Irig to it and that sounded better and more effects.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Made learning a real adventure
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is awesome. My instructor comes over with his and I thought it had a pretty huge sound for such a small amp. My amp is large compared to this one. So I ordered one of these and wow. If I’m not on the motorcycle I have a guitar and this amp in the car. I play at lunch or just to relax a bit while I watch people playing disc golf in the park. This amp has made learning to play adventurous.
customer_reviews.author: Roderic Green

customer_reviews.title: Works good on batteries, hum noise when A/C adapter is used.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent little amp when using the batteries but ..... When using a AC to DC power supply it really buzzes or hums (depends on the description of the noise), this is Very Annoying! I think this is a ground loop problem, so I am trying to figure out a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: The speaker didn't even work!!
customer_reviews.text: The speaker on the amp does not work. I had to plug in a separate computer speaker. And it is too late for me to return it. I am extremely displeased and will never by blackstar ever again
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Great little amp, this one has Bluetooth and makes play alongs or just listening to your music off your smartphone fun. Understanding this little guy only has a 3 inch speaker and doesn't have the capability of being loud but has great sound and makes practicing anywhere fun. Now I take my travel guitar to work , plug in my headphones and guitar and get a little extra practice in everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: King of Small Amps!
customer_reviews.text: The Blackstar Fly3 sounds great and is a good value. For a small amp its sound is versatile and beefy in every mode. I have several big amps but I don't enjoy using them because of their size and weight. I find myself playing more frequently because this amp is so accommodating and convenient. Despite its small size it sounds like a big amp which is very satisfying. I recommend UTube demo's if you don't believe how competitive this amp is with big amps. The option to plug in headphones is nice. Batteries last a long time and power cord is available. I'd highly recommend the Blackstar Fly3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: powerful little 3W or 6W micro amp for guitar or desktop speaker use
customer_reviews.text: Had looked at this previously but did not bite until I found this setup at the right price. The PAK comes with the expansion cabinet and an AC power supply. Green color bonus points. Completely battery powered on AA sized cells. Surprisingly loud. Seems to be much better than other micro amps. Great for travel, outdoor use, campfire jamming, have used with guitar and ukulele. Aux input means you can use these for desktop computer speakers or to play from an iPad or smartphone. Good sound shaping with their EQ and good delay. Sounds good clean or in OD. Great gift for the guitar player of any ability. I have seen them in black, red, white, green and Union Jack.
customer_reviews.author: desertfox

customer_reviews.title: Just get it...youll love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a toy. If you're a guitar player don't hesitate. This little sucker packs some big tone and is quite loud given its size. IF you're looking for a great little amp to travel with or jam in front of the tv...this is the one. The on board effects are very effective...from clean to fairly crunchy. (No Pantera or Exodus) but it does deliver some very warm Zeppelin and classic rock tones. All around GREAT little amp for 60 bucks. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jason May

customer_reviews.title: powerful little amp
customer_reviews.text: I have always had portable amps including two Fender 1 watt amps but since switching over to playing electric solid body ukelele - I wanted a more powerful amp - this little amp is perfect - it has an awesome sound and fully meets the needs for which I purchased it which is to just jam sitting anywhere i want to - it uses 8 double A batteries but sounds great - highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought, per good reviews, this portable amp instead of the other ones previously on my list. Better sound than expected and perfect for my apartment situation. Not much need for the OD, but the Delay sounds nice on medium settings with my lap steel. Even better, and more versatile, now that I followed up with the Fly103 ext. spkr. and AC adapter. Recommend you get the whole kit right off the bat, as I had to go elsewhere for the black 103.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rattling terribly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this but the rattling is driving me crazy, don’t know what it is, sounds like a bad speaker. I’m returning the amp. Thanks Amazon for a great return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 1st Amp
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 7 year old, but I've ended up using it plenty as well. It's been perfect and it sounds great. I mean I wouldn't perform with it, it's not loud enough and ultimately I prefer my tube amp, but it sounds excellent for practicing by yourself. I also love how portable it is and how we can take it on road trips if we want to. Gave my son the chance to play for his grandparents when we went to visit them. So if you're looking for something cheap and portable that still has a great sound then I think this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: messie

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't get any better than the Fly 3 in the battery powered amp catagory. Possibly the NUX, but this is still the gold standard. Update 12/29/19:. The Fly 3 is my absolute favorite. The NUX just doesn't have the tone. Not in my opinion. I've been using both for a while now. Guitar is humbucker equipped Ibanez. The Fly provides a better sound to my ears. And it's cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: WLB

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop amp / speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my home office for two purposes. I use it as a handy practice amp. And I use it as computer speakers when I want more oomph than my laptop provides. It does both admirably well but isn't superb at either. As an amp it has some good tones but is better for practicing your skills than trying to dial in a specific sound your looking for. And a dedicated computer speaker system with a separate bass unit does that job better. But if you know what you're getting, it is versatile and a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: John U

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch!
customer_reviews.text: For a 3W amp, the Blackstar Fly3 makes an outstanding performance. Doesn't include AC adapter but runs on 6 AA batteries that last a LONG time. Compared to other amps of the same range, both in price and functionality, the Fly3 has got more customization options (volume, gain, OD, the ISF and delay) that most mini amps lack. Recommended for both amateurs and pros who expect mobility, performance and a strong punch in sound.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Nitsch

customer_reviews.title: Small size, awesome sound!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound packed in a little amp! This thing really sounds good and has features I would not expect. The gain control gives that grungy rock sounds and stays pretty sharp until you crank up the volume past 80%. They delay is really nice as well. The batteries have lasted for at least 3 hors of play and still going strong. Would highly recommend this amp for anyone wanting quality sound you take wherever you want.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Nice little amp
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller amp that I could use at home that I could get some good sound from with some distortion, without annoying others in the house (or neighbors). And I hate wearing headphones while playing. I saw some reviews of this amp and decided to give it a go. I'm really liking it so far, you can't go wrong with it. It also nice to be able to pick up my electric and the small amp when I want to play in other rooms or elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Great practice and home jam Amp
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed how great this amp sounded. I've owned Fender, Vox and a HoneyTone amp. This Blackstar amp sounds 3 times better. I wish it came with a power adapter, but it does come with batteries. However if I used an adapter it would defeat the portability of the unit. I am thinking about buying another one and keeping in my travel rig.
customer_reviews.author: MAD MAX

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price is you want to slay while on the go!
customer_reviews.text: This little amp is quite impressive. It is great for jamming anywhere and with the built in headphone jack (take that iphone) i can play without bothering anyone else in the room. The effects on the amp are decent the gain and "chorus" effect are excellent and with the right adjustment can make a decent tube simulation.
customer_reviews.author: ron grimm

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Portable Practice Amp, Fly 3
customer_reviews.text: Great little practice amp. I'm able to get at least 4 good tones out of it, 2 clean settings and 2 dirty. For a 3" speaker, the sound is pretty good though I mostly use it with headphones. The bluetooth is a nice feature to play along with songs, or just use it to play music. Very happy with this, I'd recommend watching a few YouTube videos on it if you're still not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Fuller

customer_reviews.title: A better sounding mini amp, IMHO.
customer_reviews.text: As mini amps go this one is tops. Almost steps out of that mini amp tone. It would be nice if there was a reverb but that can be added as a pedal but then the reverb would be before the delay and that's not so good. An Effects loop would be sweet. Seriously though, I'm happy with it. I tried it with an MXR Compressor but not any other pedals. Driving it with the compressor seemed to fatten it up, so I'm guessing it takes pedals reasonably well.
customer_reviews.author: L Scott

customer_reviews.title: Still shocked how good it is
customer_reviews.text: With COVID it means more people home and working. The headphone feature is great and the speakers sound great when I don’t have headphones plugged in. You can pretty much get a great clean sound, then hit the gain and play with the delay to shred some solos. Or at least try and shred if you are terrible like me
customer_reviews.author: aaron Brown

customer_reviews.title: Buy One - You won't be disappointed!  Tone and functionality in a nice Union Jack package.
customer_reviews.text: Forget what you usually think when you hear battery powered practice amp. The Blackstar FLY3UJ definitely sets a new standard in battery amp tone. This amp sounds really, really good and that's coming from a pedalboard and tube amp guy. The designers rolled a lot of functionality into a very nice package. There is automatic noise suppression, a tone control knob that changes the amp emulation, delay function, gain boost button. I particularly like being able to connect my iPad mini, running ASD (amazing slow downer) into the mp3 connector and jamming with songs and/or backing tracks. Sounds fantastic whether single coil or humbucking. Great for camping if you want to jam electric around the campfire!
customer_reviews.author: MARK A

customer_reviews.title: Best in class (in my humble opinion)
customer_reviews.text: The best battery run, small desk amp under $75 bucks. I own 2 - one for my office and one for my living room. The back room has the real tube amps and these little ones keep me quite happy when I'm not there :)! I mainly play Stratocasters and PRS's and I normally only use this amp with clean settings. Sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: TicoSF

customer_reviews.title: Stunning
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a lot of experience with small battery powered amps. However, I own a Danelectro Honeytone. It doesn’t play baseball with this Fly 3. Completely different league. That being said-the Fly 3 is amazing. It’s an excellent feat of engineering that I am mad I did not buy sooner. I can’t imagine anything sounding better for the size and price of this little amp. I would consider using it for recording and I have some very nice amps. Seriously-just get one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. DiCiuccio

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal cosmic powers! Itty-bitty living space.
customer_reviews.text: Wow big sound reminds me of a quote from Aladdin Phenomenal cosmic powers! Itty-bitty living space. What kick for a little box. Can't wait to order the extra speaker. Paydays are always getting in the way...
customer_reviews.author: Pastor John

customer_reviews.title: Nice little, and I mean little
customer_reviews.text: Nice little, and I mean little, apartment amp. About 7' x 5" x 4 ", and actually small enough to fit in a suitcase for travel. Plenty of volume for my needs, which is just to get some sound to practice by. One word of caution, it DOES NOT come with an external power source, and uses a 6.5V 1.5 A source, so just go ahead and get the power source when you order the amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Rick_Lind

customer_reviews.title: This little box rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this little battery powered amp so much I bought another one just because. I was afraid to write this review bc I didn't want the price to go up? I really like the distortion and the reverb/delay makes this little battery powered amp shine above the rest. It's a little more expensive than some other little battery powered amps out there, but sound quality is much better. Blackstar really did a great job making this little amp sound a lot bigger than it is. They even make a little extension cab for it, the plug looks like an old style phone plug though not a 1/8" jack like most other small extension speakers?
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Blackstar has an amazing piece of gear in their FLY3. I can plug in and get tone anytime, day or night. Makes being a chronic insomniac more tolerable. And they give us a very decent delay for less than $70! This great little amp was my intro to the Blackstar family of amps. I've added 3 more since then, two of which are tube amps. Do they know what they're doing? It's so much fun deciding for one's self I'll just end this right here.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brat

customer_reviews.title: A surprisingly good little amp
customer_reviews.text: After reading every review on this and other small amps, I decided upon the Blackstar. I had never heard of the brand name before, but purchased it based on the reviews. So glad I did. The range from clean to distorted sounds is very good, and the tone that comes out of the very small speaker is quite impressive. Very nice little amp! I have just a few minor complaints with it. 1. Wish it came with a power supply (it can be purchased separately however). 2. I wish it had a belt clip like some of the other small amps (although it is a bit big for that).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound out of a small, portable amp!
customer_reviews.text: I could not beleive the clear, rich quality of sound from such a small, portable practice amp! Plenty of loudness for practice and not a buzz to be heard. Runs great on 6 AA batteries, get the optional power cord too, made by Blackstar (off brands make the speaker buzz). Love this little amp!
customer_reviews.author: sableshika

customer_reviews.title: Even smaller than I thought it would be,..but great sound. BIG sound.
customer_reviews.text: This little jewel is unbelievable. It's the best practise amp in the world. Take it with you anywhere,..fits in a lunch box,..looks like a lunch box,..Ha! It's the best $60 amp you will ever own. Also,..spend the money and get the proper 'Blackstar' AC Adapter...it's worth every penny. I may mic mine and record with it, it's that good. Rock on!
customer_reviews.author: M. Duwe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little amp for home practice
customer_reviews.text: For years, I practiced at home with a headphone amp. I was continually frustrated by the guitar cable and headphone cable becoming entangled. The Fly 3 sounds very good, and is perfect for low volume home practice. I can get a decent sound from the amp without making enemies! I like that it has both volume and gain controls, as well as EQ and delay. I can get a wide variety of acceptable tones from this amp. Not having cables getting tangled up is also a big relief! This little amp is ideal for home practice. For the asking price, it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp combo
customer_reviews.text: Great little amp combo. Puts out more sound than you would expect and the sound is superior to most like sized amps I've tried. Be aware though, these are not shielded speakers and will produce a huge amount of hum and distortion when plugged into a desktop PC; laptops, tablets, etc... are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan G

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little amp
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little amp. I brought it with a gathering at my friends. We had a lot of musicians there and they laughed when they saw how small it was but it all stopped when I plugged it in. We had 20 people singing along and a drummer playing a djembe. and it was only a third of the way cranked up. It was never drowned out!! I love this little amp!! Great for busking even in a loud environment. Was playing 3 hours and the batteries were still pumping out the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Krane

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I’m a beginner at guitar. Needed something for jammin’ in my room. It’s perfect! Sure beats the 15 yr old starter amp I had LOL. Definitely worth the money! Only downside is that it runs on battery and the charging cable that plugs into the wall is sold separately (But that’s probably my fault for not reading carefully)
customer_reviews.author: Abbie K

customer_reviews.title: BEST TRAVEL/PRACTICE AMP EVER1
customer_reviews.text: Saw other reviews, 99%+, took a chance. So glad. I'd give it 5 stars but I think there should be a package that includes a travel case and their own charger, often on backorger. Don't buy anything that says, "recommended, fits these sizes etc." Voids warranty, and charger volts/watts are unususual. But for sound, and yes, I include volume, this tiny terror is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Tuthill

customer_reviews.title: Good option. Very usable. Not going to love up to a full size amp in sounds quality, but good
customer_reviews.text: Yes. It sounds very impressive to it's size. Particularly the clean channel.... The high gain channel isn't quite natural sounding to me but it still not bad for such a small amp. It still sounds a little confined because of its size. Doesn't sound like a large speaker or anything. Not coming with an be AC adapter is definitely a con.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mini amps!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little practice amp. I got this because it was on a sale and it looks awesome. When I got it, wow, it had an amazing range of sounds. From clean to raging metal, you can get it. It can pretty loud too when in full stack mode (not for any gig lol) but to fill up a small room for a quiet jam with friends.
customer_reviews.author: Powerman

customer_reviews.title: 6/5 star portable amp
customer_reviews.text: not very loud but very very nice sound, the delay and overdrive give you loads of versatility in audio options. Sometimes I have to stop and be amazed this is just powered by a few AAs
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Unit bad, products usually awesome
customer_reviews.text: Noise from amp shortly after purchase. Sound was great when new, so if it would meet your needs, I would still recommend it. I got an offer for the 20w blackstar, and decided to go that route. Their amps are awesome, so I tempered my rating, which is supposed to be based on my experience. 1 star for the defective unit I got, but 5 for the return no questions asked, the awesome sound it originally provided elbeit for a short while, and for proving their quality with the larger amp I now enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Mesam Meme

customer_reviews.title: Great little portable amp.
customer_reviews.text: Great little amp for a small setting and practice. Batteries last a long time, sound is very good, and it’s very sturdy. Of course it being so small means the bass end is lacking a bit, but it has an external speaker jack. It’s the best amp that I’ve worked with in its size and price range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of volume!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing.... I rarely write reviews, however I feel compelled to comment on the blackstar amp.... I've tried several mini-amps in this price range... All but the Blackstar have been useless toys. This amp is not a toy... It has plenty of volume to be used as a practice amp. The delay feature works great with my lap-steel and dobro.... this thing is awsome. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: L. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: The perfect mini amplifier
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little amplifier that has such a great tone and sound. I love the tones I can get with this little versatile amp, and it has built-in overdrive and also delay. I have rechargeable batteries and take this on the go whenever I want to play guitar at the park, or if I visit someone that doesn’t have an amp. This is the perfect little mini amp to have.
customer_reviews.author: Miiiguel

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it 15 Stars blows the Piggy Back Amps of the 70's I had off the Planet . Very portable bought the kit with the AC adapter move it from room to room outside and can annoy the neighbors 3 doors down really ticks them off when I rip into some Gimme Three Steps, Pride and Joy or Crossroads etc. while they are blasting MC Hammerer Nillar Ice and Milli Vannilai lol
customer_reviews.author: Floyd T. Turbo

customer_reviews.title: 3 piece set!
customer_reviews.text: It comes with the extension cabinet and power cable (though no batteries included, but I'll be buying rechargable anyway) At a much cheaper price than the black set! I think the green is deeper and sexier than in the image. This amp rocks and the aux in is great for adding a drum machine, backing track, or electronic instrument!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Szanto

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value!
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as everyone says! I bought this just as a toy to have but it turns out that the effects are pretty darn good. I usually play acoustic gigs but i just bought a 1/8" to 1/4" cable and plan on using this as a preamp into the PA system to add color. Absolutely great value. Great idea if you have a kid learning guitar because they can only turn it up so loud ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Has a nice tone, the delay is nice, and I can dial in the amount of dirt I like. It could be a little louder, although that's not a big problem for the way I use it. I just make sure it's facing directly toward me. I probably wouldn't buy another, though. There are enough competitors that I'd likely try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bylenga

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, super cool
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. I own a vox ac30, Marshall plexi. Jcm 800. Jmp1, fender twin reverb. This amp is great for what it is. I use it to learn songs. And I’m very happy with it. Batter power is a cool option. I suggest some rechargables. Way nicer than the little Marshall or fender toy amps. Rock on !
customer_reviews.author: D.C. Dacey

customer_reviews.title: This is the mini...
customer_reviews.text: I have always kept a battery powered amp around for those weird spontaneous moments when I have something buzzing around in my head that I need to get out... This Fly 3 and 103 extension aren't made to be a primary amp. They ARE hands down the best battery amp I've ever played on. My Fender, Marshall, Roland and Orange portables are about to get pawned. If you need a battery amp that gets good clean to moderate crunch, this is your purchase... You won't find a better sounding micro out there.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little amp
customer_reviews.text: Amazing small small light amp... great great practice amp and backup open mic night, or for street performances
customer_reviews.author: Sean D Lowther

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portable practice amp!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Sounds better than many much more expensive amps I've used. Perfect practice amp! This makes me want to try out some of the larger Blackstar amps for sure! No popping/cracking, just good clean tone. Pop on the Gain and suddenly you're growling out some AC/DC like nobody's business. I love this versatile little amp.
customer_reviews.author: K. Runnels

customer_reviews.title: Small, quiet, sounds good
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound! It’s full and sounds like a tube amp. Also, the 1/8” aux in does a good job of a more flat sound. The power supply is 6.5 volts. Don’t lose it! This is strictly a low volume rig; it is not the right tool to play next to a rock drummer. It is very small and made out of hard plastic. If you want something that looks like a “real” amp up close, this isn’t it. It’s perfect for intimate environments, like a living room rehearsal with a cajone and unamplified vocals.
customer_reviews.author: Joel P. Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Ain't no toy
customer_reviews.text: Well made little system with amazing tone control. The satellite speaker adds volume and spaciousness to the sound, well worth having. The clean channel is so clear that every little noise and buzz is audible, which makes it great for practicing precise playing. The overdrive channel has plenty of guts for rocking out. I'm psyched to try miking this unit into a PA for performance.
customer_reviews.author: jazm44

customer_reviews.title: Not the worlds greatest amp but perfect for sitting and strumming
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. Not the worlds greatest amp but perfect for sitting and strumming. I don't use the reverb or any other "effect" because I have pedals that easily hookup. We use to as a speaker for our iPods and it works really well though the volume is controlled by the device not the amp.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Buy this ... you'll love it and so will your guitar.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and versatile little amp. I have been nothing but happy with this since I first plugged into it. The sounds that come out of this are magnificent! My other amps are collecting dust. Seriously ... this is one superb amp.
customer_reviews.author: DWS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Amp
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the size and sound quality of this little amp. I'm using it for a non-acoustic ukulele with a 5-foot cable and it's a great little setup. I would like to see the DC converter come with the amp instead of a separate purchase, but on the plus side, it came with batteries already installed. The volume it puts out and reverb features are great. I would highly recommend this for someone wanting a small and very portable practice amp for anything not requiring a lot of bass.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Reiss

customer_reviews.title: Best Micro-Amp I've found...
customer_reviews.text: Better than the Roland micro cube or mini fender amps. Surprisingly robust sound and the delay effect is quite malleable so that you can turn it into a reverb and even a gate effect. Very portable and fun to play around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Staniforth

customer_reviews.title: Seriously awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Got 5 amps. Tunes and solid states. Blackstar, Marshall, Fender and a tiny VOX. In comparison to these, this little box is awesome. The tone is sweet, warm and round - although it can be dialed up to have some raspy bite. Obviously it does not compete with a 10W tube or 30W SS, but for the size the tone is surprisingly "mature" and rich - not just loud. The delay effect is a cool upgrade. The batteries make it a pleasure to practice on the porch or by the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Clintwood

customer_reviews.title: Good amp, but the add is a lie, it does not include a guitar cable.
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with amp itself. For as little as it is, it really does produce a quality sound. The distortion is decent enough to perform pinch harmonics. The delay setting can be used as a reverb when set low, or a pretty decent delay when set full. What upset me the most was this product was advertised as coming with a guitar cable but there was no cable included.
customer_reviews.author: brian higgins

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for its size.
customer_reviews.text: Do not judge the idea of a small battery powered amp by the little toys you've heard before. This little thing has seriously good tone for cleans, rock, and very nearly metal. It's small, and it's volume matches it's size (small), but the tastiness of the tones it can produce are really fun and a pleasure to experiment with.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Think again
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product. We have used this amp for two months now and it has a high squeal in the background. Despite checking all guitar and wire components, we are unable to locate the problem. Proximity to the amp is not the problem.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Playing on the go? Get this.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little amp. I use at work during my breaks and during longer stays with friends. I liked the gain settings so much that I bought a solid state amp (Orange 35RT) to play over my Fender Bassbreaker 45 and pedal chain. I would have paid twice as much for this amp if it was necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little amp!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 other mini amps from different manufacturers both have sounded like garbage and both have burnt out. I was about done with mini amps when I saw a youtube review of this the Blackstar fly3. It's hard to judge sound quality like that but I thought I'd give one more a chance because I really don't like lugging my princeton chorus around. This little amp is amazing! All the sound and tone of big amp. Everyone I've played for can't believe this little box sounds that good. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable amp
customer_reviews.text: This amp is pretty cool. It sounds really good for a battery powered amp, much better than my old Marshall micro stack. It deliveres a good clean tone out of this small speaker. I bought the combo pack with the extension cab and advice for those looking to buy it; maybe just buy the single. While it may provide a nice stereo sound, the cord it comes with isn't really long enough to notice a difference. Still it sounds great, and you get the official power cord with the pack. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Love that it is so small
customer_reviews.text: I was so shocked at the power this little amp provides...My daughter has 2 electric guitars and carries this everywhere she goes with her guitar!! Love that it is so small, and easy to just drop in her backpack.....runs on batteries too! They lasted a long time! We did a lot of research before we bought it but worth every penny......and we also have an adapter for plugging it in the wall....super easy! you can't go wrong with this little blackstar Fly3
customer_reviews.author: Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, inexpensive, small foot print, and portable!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 7 watt Fly3 combo. Arrived within 5 days and worked perfectly. Even after watching many reviews on YouTube, I found this mini amp to be better than I ever expected. I normally use a 300 Watt Yamaha, but the Fly3 has replaced it for my practicing purposes...the Fly3 really surpasses the reviews...can't be beat for the sound or money invested
customer_reviews.author: P. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Blackened!
customer_reviews.text: My first Blackstar. Wow. I’ve had Marshall amps and was just recent that I tried Blackstar just for curiosity & instantly got hooked. The sound is comparably British but the unique EQ gives it an appealing tone by dialing your preference. Plus the Delay makes this stand out. And if you’re not noticing it’s a mini amp, you’ll feel you’re playing on a usual amp size! I tried their bigger amps & got impressed as well. The Union Jack style also makes this “mini” amp cool! Also, I got a power adapter for $5. Just make sure it is + inside, 6.5V & bought a 2.5mm male plug adapter ($1), the amps power adapter input is unusual.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Grace Limjuco Sumaya

customer_reviews.title: Can't turn it up past "3"!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe how good these sound--and in stereo no less (seriously, when I hook these up to my computer they serve as decent stereo speakers). I'm a blues guy but the sound these babies creates makes my wanna shred like 80s rocker.
customer_reviews.author: Fueradeljuego

customer_reviews.title: Works great and small for travel
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by the Fly 3 Blue Tooth for travel I got this for messing around in the house and backyard. Sound it great as long as not cranked - I have an effects pedal board in front of it and it works well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and portable
customer_reviews.text: I got this so i could get some sound from my electric guitar in college without hauling my big amp around. It's adorable and it sounds pretty good. It can use batteries, which is nice for portability. However, if you want to have a corded power supply, you're going to have to pay at least $20 if not more to get the right one. I think Blackstar has a power supply for it, i got one from Best Buy that works but cost like $25
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great for home practice
customer_reviews.text: Super clean sound throughout the amplifier range. Delay range is OK. I use a wall adapter, but there is no hum or extra noises. Very useful for practicing finger picking as I can hear the attacks on each string very clearly. I use it for my ukulele, which sounds... different... on full overdrive, which is just a lot of fun. Plenty of amplification for soloing at the coffee house.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry010101

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little get together.  Surprising great sound
customer_reviews.text: Came with batteries! Nice. Took my travel guitar lite with cable and this to a get together on beach the same night I got it. Perfect! Ran backing tracks w my phone on MP 3 in as well and we jammed .
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

product_meta.title: Blackstar FLY3 Guitar Amplifier Head- Royal Blue
product_meta.description: style:Amp| Color:Royal BlueThe FLY 3 is a compact mini amp with big TONE. Combining two channels, our patented Infinite Shape Feature (ISF) and a 'tape' delay, it's the perfect take-anywhere amp or set of portable speakers when combined with the FLY 103. The FLY 3 is an innovative, cutting edge 3 watt mini amp which combines two channels, tape delay and the Blackstar patented Infinite Shape Feature (ISF) to create the perfect compact and portable guitar amplifier. It packs a punch with big TONE, even at the lowest volumes. The ISF allows you to infinitely change the sound of your FLY 3, which gives you endless possibilities on the tone of your amp. The FLY 3 also features tape delay effects, allowing you to make your amp output resonate during play. The FLY 3 also comes with an MP3 / LINE IN jack built in, allowing you to connect to your MP3 player, mobile phone, laptop, tablet etc. and jam along to your favourite tracks; the Emulated Output jack can also be used with headphones. Capable of being battery powered, you can take the FLY 3 with you wherever you go. You can combine the FLY 3 with the FLY 103 (sold separately) to create a 6 watt guitar amp setup which creates a stereo effect when playing your guitar or listening to your favourite tunes. The pair of them linked together create one of the best portable speakers, pc speakers or computer speakers to play your music through.
feature_bullets: MP3 / Line In for jamming along or listening to music
Emulated Line Out for 'silent' practice or recording

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,788 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
